alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 12:59AM PST until January 08 at 11:51AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Oregon...Washington... Tualatin River near Dilley affecting Washington County. Cowlitz River at Kelso affecting Cowlitz County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Washington... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Polk and Benton Counties. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Tillamook and Clatsop Counties. Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. Pudding River at Aurora affecting Clackamas and Marion Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely, especiallly if the Willamette is running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:51 PM PST Friday the stage was 27.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:51 PM PST Friday was 27.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling through the weekend. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
